name: **Inisbroon      Inis Brún**
description: Inisbroon Inis Brún L635-640 Sheet 37 Lovely grassy island, the shape and gimp of which strongly suggests inner Clew Bay, with its high clay cliff to seaward and grassy slopes to leeward. It lies 1km off Renvyle Point. Many sheep and lazybeds, between which grow thistles. Firewood abounds, and to the N is a lovely horseshoe bay, sheltered at all times, but it is stony and rocky. Better swimming in shallow bay to SW. Rock Pipit breeding.
